title: card.aux.serial Request Application Programming Interface (API) Schema
description: Configure various uses of the AUXTX and AUXRX pins on the Notecard's edge connector.

mode.description: The AUX mode. Must be one of the following:

sub-descriptions.description: (Default) for request/response monitoring on the AUX pins.
Use an external GPS/GNSS module on the AUX pins.
Used along with one or more of the options below to send streaming data or notification data over the AUX pins. When used alone, preserves existing notification settings.
Used to stream readings from the onboard accelerometer over AUX.
Used to notify the host of any [Inbound Signals](/guides-and-tutorials/notecard-guides/minimizing-latency/#using-inbound-signals) from Notehub.
Used to notify the host of Environment Variable changes over AUX.
Used to notify the host that the Notecard has downloaded updated host firmware.

duration.description: If using `"mode": "accel"`, specify a sampling duration for the Notecard accelerometer.

rate.description: The baud rate or speed at which information is transmitted over AUX serial. The default is `115200` unless using GPS, in which case the default is `9600`.

limit.description: If `true`, along with `"mode":"gps"` the Notecard will disable concurrent modem use during GPS tracking.

max.description: The maximum amount of data to send per session, in bytes. This is typically set to the size of the receive buffer on the host minus `1`. For example, `note-arduino` uses a buffer size of `(SERIAL_RX_BUFFER_SIZE - 1)`.

ms.description: The delay in milliseconds before sending a buffer of `max` size.

minutes.description: When using `"mode": "notify,dfu"`, specify an interval for notifying the host.

annotations.title: note
annotations.description: Utilizing these pins requires a physical connection to each pin, separate from a connection to the Notecard's serial data interfaces. See [this guide](/guides-and-tutorials/notecard-guides/debugging-with-the-ftdi-debug-cable/) for an example of connecting to the Notecard AUX pins using an FTDI cable.

annotations.title: info
annotations.description: Use an external GPS/GNSS module connected to the AUX pins. Using an external GPS/GNSS module allows you to acquire GPS/GNSS location while Notecard is connected to Notehub in `continuous` mode. Learn more at [Using AUX Serial GPS Mode](/notecard/notecard-walkthrough/working-with-the-notecard-aux-pins#using-aux-serial-gps-mode).
